ranking.description: Text editor for your terminal: easy, powerful and fast
ranking.description_ja: Text editor for your terminal: easy, powerful and fast
ranking.readme_summary: Fresh A terminal-based text editor. Official Website â†’ **ğŸ“¦ Installation Instructions** **Contributing** Why? Why another text editor? Fresh brings the intuitive, conventional UX of editors like VS Code and Sublime Text to the terminal. While veterans like Emacs and Vim - and newer editors like Neovim and Helix - are excellent for power users who prefer modal, highly specialized workflows, they often present a steep learning curve for those used to standard GUI interactions

ranking.description: Self-hosted YouTube downloader (web UI for youtube-dl / yt-dlp)
ranking.readme_summary: MeTube !Build Status !Docker Pulls Web GUI for youtube-dl (using the yt-dlp fork) with playlist support. Allows you to download videos from YouTube and dozens of other sites. !screenshot1 ğŸ³ Run using Docker ğŸ³ Run using docker-compose âš™ï¸ Configuration via environment variables Certain values can be set via environment variables, using the -e parameter on the docker command line, or the environment: section in docker-compose

> **Note:** This repository contains Anthropic's implementation of skills for Claude. For information about the Agent Skills standard, see agentskills.io. Skills Skills are folders of instructions, scripts, and resources that Claude loads dynamically to improve performance on specialized tasks

ranking.description: A free, open source, and extensible speech-to-text application that works completely offline.
ranking.readme_summary: Handy ![Discord](https://discord.com/invite/WVBeWsNXK4) **A free, open source, and extensible speech-to-text application that works completely offline.** Handy is a cross-platform desktop application built with Tauri (Rust + React/TypeScript) that provides simple, privacy-focused speech transcription. Press a shortcut, speak, and have your words appear in any text fieldâ€”all without sending your voice to the cloud. Why Handy?
